meanings.definition: Reaching a high or the highest degree; very great.
meanings.sent1: The weather was extreme, with scorching heat all day.
meanings.sent2: The extreme cold made it difficult to go outside.
meanings.sent3: It was extreme how many cookies he ate in one sitting!
meanings.sent4: Her extreme dedication to her craft paid off in the end.
meanings.sent5: The extreme beauty of the sunset took my breath away.

meanings.definition: The highest or most intense point or level.
meanings.sent1: He reached the extreme of his excitement when he won the game.
meanings.sent2: The mountain climber faced the extreme of the summit.
meanings.sent3: The extreme of the roller coaster ride left her laughing uncontrollably.
meanings.sent4: The tension in the room reached an extreme during the argument.
meanings.sent5: The extreme of her happiness was evident in her wide smile.

meanings.definition: Beyond what is usual or reasonable; excessive.
meanings.sent1: His extreme behavior at the party caused quite a stir.
meanings.sent2: The extreme price of the luxury car was out of reach for most people.
meanings.sent3: It was extreme how many toppings he piled on his pizza!
meanings.sent4: The extreme demands of the job left him feeling overwhelmed.
meanings.sent5: The extreme speed of the car made my heart race with fear.
